title: Computer-generated imagery
summary: Computer-generated imagery (CGI) is the application of computer graphics to create or contribute to images in art, printed media, video games,  simulators, computer animation and VFX in films, television programs, shorts, commercials, and videos. The images may be dynamic or static, and may be two-dimensional (2D), although the term "CGI" is most commonly used to refer to the 3-D computer graphics used for creating characters, scenes and special effects in films and television, which is described as "CGI animation".
